title.rendered: Algoma University Online Application | Winter Term 2024

content.rendered:
Algoma University Fees Payment, Algoma University Application – Winter Semester 2024, Algoma University Application Waiver, Algoma University Online Programs Portal, List of Courses/Programs offered at Algoma University, Application fees of $70 for Canadian Applicant and $125.00 CDN for International Students, Algoma Residence Application, Application Deadlines.

This is to inform the entire public both Canadian and International Students seeking admission into Undergraduate programs of Algoma University, that the application portal is open for application for Winter Semester 2024 and will be closed on January 2024.

Algoma University Admission Application fee cost: $70

Interested Candidates should apply through the Ontario Undergrad 101 Portal or Ontario Undergrad 105 Application Portal.

Algoma University Location

1520 Queen St E,
Sault Ste.
Marie,
ON P6A 2G4,
Canada

Algoma University Acceptance Rate

27%

How to Apply

To apply as Undergrad 101 Applicant:         UNDERGRAD 101 Application

To Apply as Undergrad 105 Applicant:         UNDERGRAD 105 Application

 

How to Apply for Admission into Algoma University (January Admission)

  • Go to https://apply.algomau.ca/
  • Click apply to either Ontario Application 101 or Ontario Application 105
  • Select program choice
  • Select the Algoma University
  • Complete your application
  • Pay a non-refundable application fee of $70 (CDN funds) payable to Algoma University
  • Submit your application.

Algoma University Admission Requirement

Algoma Admission Requirements by Province:

All interested applicants seeking admission into Algoma University should note the following requirements;

  • Applicants from Alberta University: Possess Five (5) academic courses numbered 30, 30-1, or 31
  • Applicants from British Columbia: Five academic courses numbered 12
  • Applicants from Manitoba: Five academic grade 12 courses at the 40 level
  • Applicants from New Brunswick: Five academic grade 12 level
  • Applicants from Newfoundland: Ten credits from academic courses numbered 3000 or higher
  • Applicants from Maya Scotia: Five academic courses numbered 12
  • Applicants from Nunavut/Northwest Territories: Five academic courses numbered 30, 30-1, or 31
  • Applicants from Prince Edward Island: Five academic courses at the grade 12 level
  • Applicants from Quebec: Six academic grade 12 courses
  • Applicants from Saskatchewan: Five academic courses at the grade 12 level
  • Applicants from Yukon: Five academic courses numbered 12

Algoma Admission Requirements by Courses:

  • Bachelor of Arts, Music – an Audition certificate is added advantage
  • Bachelor of Arts, Psychology – does not require additional prerequisites
  • Bachelor of Business Administration – Require Grade 12 academic Mathematics
  • Bachelor of Computer Science – Require Grade 12 academic Mathematics
  • Bachelor of Science, Computer Science – Require Grade 12 academic Mathematics and two Require Grade 12 academic sciences (Biology & Chemistry recommended)
  • Bachelor of Fine Arts in Visual Arts – a Portfolio certificate is added advantage
  • Bachelor of Science, Biology – Require Grade 12 academic Mathematics and two Gr. 12 academic sciences (Biology & Chemistry recommended)
  • Bachelor of Science, Psychology – Require Grade 12 academic Mathematics and two Gr. 12 academic sciences (Biology & Chemistry recommended)
  • Bachelor of Science, Environmental Science – Require Grade 12 academic Mathematics and two Gr. 12 academic sciences (Biology & Chemistry recommended)
  • Bachelor of Social Work – does not require additional prerequisites.

International Baccalaureate Admission Guidelines (International Students)

  • The IB Diploma requires a minimum of 26 points to be accepted for admission.
  • Also Candidates with 28 points or higher in the IB Diploma will be qualified for the scholarship.
  • To be considered for Credit Transfer, Candidates must attain a minimum of 28 points in the IB diploma with a minimum grade of 5 in either Standard (SL) or Higher (HL) Level courses.
  • Applicants who have completed AP exams with a minimum final grade of 4 will be eligible to receive university credits for up to a maximum of 12 credits (four full courses).
  • International students must also have 5-6 traditional academic courses in the final year of senior secondary including English.
  • A minimum average of 65%/70% score or country-specific equivalent is required for International Students
  • Proof of language proficiency for non-native English speakers is required.
  • International students should submit copies of all transcripts including secondary school transcripts, secondary school diplomas, post-secondary school transcripts, and diplomas/degrees where applicable.
  • Gap Letter/Gap Explanation to include a resume, letters of employment, additional undeclared academic history, and/or a personal letter of explanation should be submitted, for international students.
